title: What's Your Learning Style?
instructions: For each question, select ALL the options that apply to you.

questions.question: When you're trying to remember something, you usually...

options.text: Picture it or visualize it in your mind
Repeat the information aloud or in your head
Write it down or read about it again
Try doing it physically or practice with hands-on activities

questions.question: In a classroom or presentation, you prefer the teacher to...

options.text: Use diagrams, charts, or videos
Explain things verbally and give examples
Provide written handouts or reading materials
Include interactive activities or demonstrations

questions.question: When studying for an exam, you...

options.text: Use mind maps, flowcharts, or draw out ideas
Talk through the material with others or out loud to yourself
Review notes, textbooks, or write summaries
Use flashcards or hands-on practice questions

questions.question: You find it easiest to learn new skills when...

options.text: You see someone demonstrate them first
Someone verbally explains each step to you
You read or write out the instructions carefully
You get to try it yourself through practice

questions.question: Which activity do you enjoy most when exploring new information?

options.text: Watching videos or looking at images
Listening to podcasts or discussions
Reading articles or taking notes
Conducting experiments or hands-on activities
